page.title: Human rights in Egypt under the Supreme Council of the Armed Forces

rev.diff:
Line 10: Line 10:
Egyptian blogger and activist [[Hossam el-Hamalawy]], television host [[Reem Maged]] and journalist [[Nabil Sharaf El-Din]] were given a summons on 30 May 2011 to appear before military prosecution after Maged brought Hamalawy on her show where he criticized the role of military police, holding the head of the military police responsible for torturing activists.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/~/NewsContent/1/64/13270/Egypt/Politics-/Egyptian-journalists-to-be-questioned-tomorrow-by-.aspx |title=Egyptian journalists to be questioned tomorrow by military for denouncing the torture of activists - Politics - Egypt - Ahram Online |publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date= |accessdate=30 May 2011}}</ref> They were released Tuesday after "chatting" with Military Prosecution and Hossam el-Hamalawy was asked to hand reports of army abuses to authorities.<ref name="DailyEgypt">{{cite web|url=http://thedailynewsegypt.com/human-a-civil-rights/blogger-asked-to-hand-reports-of-army-abuses-to-authorities.html |title=Blogger asked to hand reports of army abuses to authorities |publisher=Thedailynewsegypt.com |date= |accessdate=7 June 2011}}</ref>
Egyptian blogger and activist [[Hossam el-Hamalawy]], television host [[Reem Maged]] and journalist [[Nabil Sharaf El-Din]] were given a summons on 30 May 2011 to appear before military prosecution after Maged brought Hamalawy on her show where he criticized the role of military police, holding the head of the military police responsible for torturing activists.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/~/NewsContent/1/64/13270/Egypt/Politics-/Egyptian-journalists-to-be-questioned-tomorrow-by-.aspx |title=Egyptian journalists to be questioned tomorrow by military for denouncing the torture of activists - Politics - Egypt - Ahram Online |publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date= |accessdate=30 May 2011}}</ref> They were released Tuesday after "chatting" with Military Prosecution and Hossam el-Hamalawy was asked to hand reports of army abuses to authorities.<ref name="DailyEgypt">{{cite web|url=http://thedailynewsegypt.com/human-a-civil-rights/blogger-asked-to-hand-reports-of-army-abuses-to-authorities.html |title=Blogger asked to hand reports of army abuses to authorities |publisher=Thedailynewsegypt.com |date= |accessdate=7 June 2011}}</ref>
â
Egyptian blogger and activist [[Rasha Azab]] and Al-Fagr newspaper Editor in Chief [[Adel Hammouda]] have been summoned by military prosecution. They are to appear before military prosecutors on 19 June 2011<ref name="ahram1">http://english.ahram.org.eg/News/14532.aspx</ref>. Azab published an article in Al-Fagr newspaper detailing the meeting that took place between members of the Supreme Council of the Armed Forces (SCAF) and the No to Military Trials campaigners<ref name="ahram1"/>.
+
Egyptian blogger and activist [[Rasha Azab]] and [[El Fagr]] newspaper Editor in Chief [[Adel Hammouda]] have been summoned by military prosecution. They are to appear before military prosecutors on 19 June 2011<ref name="ahram1">http://english.ahram.org.eg/News/14532.aspx</ref>. Azab published an article in El Fagr newspaper detailing the meeting that took place between members of the Supreme Council of the Armed Forces (SCAF) and the No to Military Trials campaigners<ref name="ahram1"/>.
